lines.text: [about a motorcycle]
Is it safe?
It's the safest thing you'll ever have between your legs.
What?
Nothing!
Stay away from him, he's a boy!
Velcro. Next to the Walkman and tab it is the coolest invention of the 20th century!
Do you have a date or something?
No I wish, I just know I must be horny.
[Being told to tell about herself and her interests]

Army bases are pretty dead, unless you're in the Army. So I always had a lot of time to daydream, and my daydream was always the same - that some day, I was going to get to Chicago, because that's where they make Dance TV.
I love to dance!
Daaaaay-o! Day you say day you say da-a-ay-o!
Miss. Stone, there is a time and a place for calypso music!
Sorry, I needed the phone.
Why, the cabbage patch mothers are having a PTA meeting?
If I win I'm going to be on TV alright?
Negative!
[Janey is asking her father for permission to audition for DTV]
You're too young to go out at night, except for the occasional supervised school activity. When you're eighteen, then you're entitled to some nightlife. Now we had a deal, remember?
We made a deal when I was seven and a half and night life was The Muppet Show!
Don't sass me!
I'm sorry, sir.
My shrink is right - I'm unloved, unappreciated, I only have one car...

[to Janey]
Do you do everything you're told?... oh, God. You do.
[Jeff is pushing Drew's old, corroded, smoking, brown Mercedes until the engine will start up]
You don't understand that this car makes a statement.
Yeah, it says, 'Hi, I'm garbage.'
Whenever I'm in a room with a guy, no matter who it is - a date my dentist, anybody - I think, If we were the last two people on Earth, would I puke if he kissed me?
You move, you bleed...
Eat flame, Bozo!
...So I said, 'Sister, please, anyone could have confused 'Hail Mary' with 'Proud Mary' and besides, I do a very good Tina Turner!'
[Lynne steps up to get her contestant number for the DTV audition]
Hi, I'm Lynne Stone. My lucky number is twenty-one.
Uhuh. Next.
[Lady hands her # 87]

[to Janey]
I have a real way with authority figures.
Oh, I like this. Sort of Rebel Without a Cause meets Sound of Music... you're taking a fashion risk. I like that. Just don't do it on camera!
You know what's better than getting mad? Getting even.
I lifted the music news to the level of art and you are treating me like cattle!
Moo! Okay? Moo!
I quit!
Great... not great...
America's number one dance show, Dance TV, is on the air!
Patty and I have a little business to attend to. The term papers are in- Eisonhower, Johnson, Kennedy...
Kennedy! Oh, he was so cute! How much?
A date with me.
I'll take Johnson.
So where were you last night? I waited out there for an hour and a half!
Well I tried to tell you that I couldn't go, but you hung up to fast.
Excuse me! Do either one of you have change for a twenty?

[sarcastically]
Gosh, I dont' have anything smaller than a fifty.
[Janey looks at Jeff as if asking him if he has change]
Sorry.
My Loss. Have fun.
You dress left or right?
Ughh... well, my closet's on the left side of my bed, So I guess I dress left. Except if I have to wear something out of the hamper, cause that's on the right side of the sink...
[Straightens up and nervously talks]
LEFT!
So I tried to call you yesterday... to see if you wanted to reherse, I mean.
Oh, ummm... well my dad made us all go to the airshow.
Was it fun?
200 people standing around like this
[looks up at the sky and sarcastically says]
It was a blast!
I can't believe that in two weeks I'm going to be dancing on DTV!
[calms down from the excitement]
I bet I'd get hit by a car!
What?
No, things are going to well. I mean besides DTV, I have a best friend, and I mean, I'd never dreamed in a million years that I would have a boyfriend!
[last lines]
Daddy!
Why don't you shut up?
Do you really think I'm punk? Well, that's outrageous! I mean, it's not as cool as new wave, but it's a lot better than pre-teen!
This is really embarrassing.
Woo!
He's just uh! You know. I mean uh!
Is he gonna call you tomorrow?
Yeah, I think so.
This... means... *war*.
Nice car. I drive exotic wheels myself.
What is it? A Schwinn ten-speed?
There's this really big Latin test on Monday and, um, I'm way way behind.
Since when do you take Latin?
Since last week which is why I'm way behind.

[sitting on Jeff's motorcycle]
I'm holding this for ransom.
[Jeff gives her a look]
Awww, did you and Shirley Temple have a bad rehearsal?
Yeah, it wasn't one of the best five afternoons of my life. I'm not really in the mood to shoot the breeze so if you don't mind...
*Fine*.
My name's Lynne Stone.
Hi.
But I'm gonna change it as soon as I'm old enough.
We have met the enemy and she has B.O.
Zach!
So how was work, Pop?
Oh uh,
[chuckles]
positively stimulating as usual.
Mr. Sands, Drew Gorman. Gorman Enterprises. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.

[shaking hands]
How do you do?
Oh fine. This is a beautiful party. Must have cost a bundle though.
Well, I'll probably recover.
Oh, I know you will. Natalie is worth every penny of it.
Yes, yes. Wonderful girl.
Oh, she's terrific.
Well, Mr. Gorman, it's certainly nice to see you.
It was a pleasure to meet you sir.
[they shake hands again]
Thank you.

[still hanging around Mr. Sands]
So! How about them Cubs? I think it's their year!
Jonathan and Lisa are definitely my favorite couple. You know his birthday is the same as mine almost.

[phone starts ringing while Lynne and Janey are watching Rikki on DTV]
In other news, Paul McCartney bought up the publishing rights to all locomotive sound effects tapes. This makes Paul rich...

[answers phone]
Hello?
...but does it make him happy?

[to person on other end]
No hablo ingles.
[hangs up the phone]
Well, we're almost out of time but tune in tomorrow for a sneak preview of 7 more songs titled "Jump"!
Hi! We need fifty of these right away.
[she hands Natalie's invitation to clerk at copy store]
Lynne!
There's a few people Natalie forgot to invite.

[to clerk]
Make it a hundred and fifty.

[claps]
Yea!
We're so cool.

[At The Court]
You'd be great at a game called Tune in Tokyo. Now you must put your hands behind your head and say, beep, beep, beep... and twist at the waist
beep... beep... beep
[as she moves waist from side to side]
it's WWII and our ship is going down in the middle of the Pacific and our only hope is the short wave radio.
[Drew puts his hands on Tiffany's breasts and twists them as if they were radio knobs]
Tune in, Tokyo! Tune in Tokyo!...
[Tiffany hits him with her purse and stomps off]
He's a boy and he's alive, what's there to hate?

[carried onto set by 4 muscular guys]
Let's all hear it for steroids. And now, the news!
